meanings.definition: The act of directing or managing a performance or production.
meanings.sent1: The regie of the play ensured all actors knew their cues.
meanings.sent2: She studied regie to become a successful theater director.
meanings.sent3: The regie of the musical made sure the actors didn't bump into each other on stage.
meanings.sent4: His regie over the film set was like a conductor leading an orchestra.
meanings.sent5: The regie of the ballet brought the story to life with precision and grace.

meanings.definition: A style of directing or managing a performance or production.
meanings.sent1: Her regie was known for its innovative use of lighting and sound.
meanings.sent2: The regie of the opera was traditional yet captivating.
meanings.sent3: The regie of the play had a unique flair that kept the audience engaged.
meanings.sent4: His regie was like a painter creating a masterpiece on stage.
meanings.sent5: The regie of the film was bold and visually stunning.

meanings.definition: The authority or control over something.
meanings.sent1: The manager had regie over the store's inventory.
meanings.sent2: She asserted her regie over the project with confidence.
meanings.sent3: The cat believed it had regie over the entire house.
meanings.sent4: His regie over the team was firm but fair.
meanings.sent5: The queen's regie over the kingdom was unquestioned.
